title: Do you think "GGEZ" should be a bannable offense?
body: Kind of said it right there. Now I know what most will say... "Don't be a baby" or "Stop crying" but GGEZ is just as toxic as any other BM out there so I think that maybe it should be taken just as serious for bans. Just my thought.

replies.body:
I believe that it is unnecessarily disrespectful and counts as a form of negative behaviour.

It is already a punishable offense.
Saying ez at the end of a game is essentially saying you were elected for douchebag of the year.

it already is bannable offense, it goes under point 6 of the SC:

> Show Humility in Victory, and Grace in Defeat
While it's alright to celebrate, make sure that you keep any gloating (or any other mode of self-indulgence) out of all chat. Instead, thank your opponents for the game. After all, despite their best efforts, they just made you a very happy person.

i would also like to quote a Community Coordinator on EUW named RoniBoo who posted this back in 2012 on the topic:

> Hello StrokeZ
Paragraph VI of the Summoner `s Code says : Show Humility in Victory, and Grace in Defeat
http://na.leagueoflegends.com/articles/The_Summoners_Code
Saying "gg easy" is very discouraging for the enemy team. It is an example of bad sportsmanship and a clear violation of the 4th paragraph of the Summoner`s Code.
Please bear in mind that you can enjoy yourself, but not at anyone elseâ€™s expense.

link to the post: http://forums.euw.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=722772&page=1#post7531869


regards 

higura

It's basically saying "you guys suck lol." Of course it should be handled that way when it's said with that intention.

It is already confirmed to be negative by the punishment systems. A lot of people, in my opinion, way overexaggerated its severity. Calling it bannable is technically true I guess, but imo misleading. From what I have seen it is a drop in the bucket, like most individual things. If the only thing you ever did wrong was saying GGEZ at the end of a game I doubt you would ever be punished. 

It just happens to be a common thing people who are otherwise negative say. It typically also happens at the end of the game so it is fresh in peoples minds which probably makes it more likely to be reported.

I mean, yeah gg ez is very annoying to deal with, but to ban someone over it? Not so sure. I mean, there is always going to be that person, sometimes you just need thick skin and ignore it. Tilt happens because you let it happen, not because someone else tilts you per say.

Eh, might as well chip in.

As far as offenses go, ggez is pretty weaksauce. There are plenty of waaay more hurtful insults that need to be weeded out first: racial slurs, death threats, rape threats etc etc

BUT! (And that's a big but, think Irelia)

GGEZ is as unsportsmanlike as it can go. That's the equivalent of spitting at your opponents hand at the end of the match. This isn't trashtalk. Trashtalk is during or pre game. This isn't the funny kind of Trick2G disrespect to make your opponent tilt this is the kind of disrespect that makes the coach slap you behind the head and make you go back and apologise. 

So IMO it should lead to chat restrictions and repeated offenses to banning. Cause, ggez hotshots, try to remember that at the end of every boxing/tennis/football game the opponents shake hands for a fucking reason, you incosiderate twats.

Fuck off with your hyperbolic nonsense.

Should "ggez" be bannable? I thought this was a joke thread when I read that. How fucking sensitive are you that you need to retaliate with a _ban_ (either temporary or permanent) when someone throws four letters at you? It's already against the Summoner's Code, and it can stay that way. But making it banworthy by itself is absolutely laughable.
